docs.lead_paragraph: Following is the first set of responses from Dr. Laura Erickson-Schroth, who is working on "Trans Bodies, Trans Selves," a resource guide for transgender and other gender-variant people, covering health, legal issues, cultural and social questions, history and theory.
docs.abstract: Taking Questions: Dr. Laura Erickson-Schroth, who is working on a resource guide for transgender and other gender-variant people, responds to readers.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: Dr. Laura Erickson-Schroth, who is working on a resource guide for transgender and other gender-variant people, responds to readers.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Wednesday Reading: Renting a Bike on a Budget

docs.abstract: Buying versus renting in the sour housing market, federal regulation of insurance rates and other consumer-focused items from Wednesday's Times.
docs.snippet: Buying versus renting in the sour housing market, federal regulation of insurance rates and other consumer-focused items from Wednesday's Times.

headline.main: Can Parents Cover Their Married Children?

docs.abstract: Adult children will be able to enroll in their parents' health plans even if they are married.
docs.snippet: Adult children will be able to enroll in their parents' health plans even if they are married.

docs.lead_paragraph: While Congress deals with how to revamp the nation's financial rules, the Obama administration is set to unveil the new look of the $100 bill.
docs.abstract: Administration officials unveil Benjamin Franklin's $100 makeover, while Congress resumes financial regulatory negotiations.
docs.snippet: Administration officials unveil Benjamin Franklin's $100 makeover, while Congress resumes financial regulatory negotiations.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president got health care reform passed, and it may turn out to be his single most important foreign policy achievement.
docs.snippet: The president got health care reform passed, and it may turn out to be his single most important foreign policy achievement.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health care reform in Massachusetts is popular, and it is working. The next step is to figure out how to rein in the costs of care.
docs.snippet: Health care reform in Massachusetts is popular, and it is working. The next step is to figure out how to rein in the costs of care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fearing that health insurance premiums may shoot up in the next few years, Senate Democrats Tuesday laid a foundation for federal regulation of rates.

headline.main: Senate Bill Sets a Plan to Regulate Premiums
headline.print_headline: Senate Democrats Lay Out a Plan To Regulate Health Insurance Premiums

docs.snippet: Fearing that health insurance premiums may shoot up in the next few years, Senate Democrats Tuesday laid a foundation for federal regulation of rates.

headline.main: Can Insurers Still Cap Physical Therapy Visits?

docs.abstract: Insurers whose plans must offer "essential benefits" are still permitted to limit their, so long as their plans' provisions reflect the benefits of a typical employer plan.
docs.snippet: Insurers whose plans must offer "essential benefits" are still permitted to limit their, so long as their plans' provisions reflect the benefits of a typical employer plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: A possible strike this week by the doormen’s union could impose — by necessity — a spirit of cooperation in New York City’s co-ops and other apartment buildings.

headline.seo: If New York Doormen Strike, Residents Must Pitch In
headline.main: If Doormen Strike, Residents Must Pick Up the Slack
headline.print_headline: If Doormen Strike, Residents Must Pick Up the Slack

docs.snippet: A possible strike this week by the doormen’s union could impose — by necessity — a spirit of cooperation in New York City’s co-ops and other apartment buildings.
